subject: Re: [junit] What is the error?
msgSnippet: ... [Stacktrace snip] ... Great, junit is working then 8). ... [code snip] ... Why this test fails is a java question, and not really something for this list.
messageBody:
Varuna Seneviratna wrote:
> I don't know what went wrong or how it started working But when I run
> java MoneyTest now here is the result
>
> C:\JunitTest>java MoneyTest JUnit version 4.5 .E Time: 0.047 There
> was 1 failure: 1) simpleAdd(MoneyTest) java.lang.AssertionError:
> Failed the test at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:91) at
> org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:43) at
> MoneyTest.simpleAdd(MoneyTest.java:11) at
[Stacktrace snip]

> Please tell me how to read these Test Messages. The test message that
> I codded to display if the test was a failure is displayed.
Great, junit is working then 8).
>Please
> tell me why the test is a failure according to the below classes
>

[code snip]

>> Assert.assertTrue("Failed the test",expected.equals(result));

Why this test fails is a java question, and not really something for
this list.

Things you should do:-

- Find out what why expected.equals(result) is not == true. Google
might help you here.

- Recode your test as Assert.assertEquals(expected,result) and
recompile/rerun your tests. This will give a much better failure
message than the one you have coded; if it fails!

- Pick yourself an IDE (or two), so you can see which one suits you best.

- debug your code within your new IDE so you can find out what is going on.

- set your reply-to on your postings to be junit@yahoogroups.com,
instead of you email address.

- Please take some time to read
http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html it will help (us
both) 8).


--
Mark
